IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO OPEN AND OPERATE SMALL, HIGH-QUALITY CHARTER SCHOOLS IN LOW-INCOMENEIGHBORHOODS; TO INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF UNDERSERVEDSTUDENTS; TO DEVELOP EFFECTIVE EDUCATORS; TO SHARE SUCCESSFUL PRACTICESWITH OTHER FORWARD THINKING EDUCATORS; TO CATALYZE CHANGE IN PUBLICSCHOOLS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO OPEN AND OPERATE SMALL, HIGH-QUALITY CHARTER SCHOOLS IN LOW-INCOMENEIGHBORHOODS; TO INCREASE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF UNDERSERVEDSTUDENTS; TO DEVELOP EFFECTIVE EDUCATORS; TO SHARE SUCCESSFUL PRACTICESWITH OTHER FORWARD THINKING EDUCATORS; TO CATALYZE CHANGE IN PUBLICSCHOOLS.
IRS990.Desc: ASPIRE PUBLIC SCHOOLS BUILDS AND OPERATES HIGH QUALITY PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS TO PREPARE STUDENTS FOR COLLEGE. ASPIRE PUBLIC SCHOOLS OPERATES 40 SCHOOLS SERVING OVER 16,000 STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS INCLUDED IN ALL ADVERTISEMENTS AND IT IS INCLUDED IN OUR ENROLLMENT MATERIALS AND OUR CHARTER AS A PUBLIC SCHOOL.
ASPIRE PUBLIC SCHOOLS RECEIVES MOST OF ITS FUNDING FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AGENCIES.

ASPIRE DOES NOT MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AFTER THE GRANT IS ISSUED. HOWEVER, EACH APPLICANT GOES THROUGH AN APPLICATION PROCESS WHERE THE GRANT COMMITTEE EVALUATES POTENTIAL GRANT RECIPIENT AND AWARD A GRANT SUBJECT TO PROVIDING EVIDENCE OF ENROLLMENT IN COLLEGE COURSES.
THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS METHOD USED WAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS RECORDKEEPING PRACTICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 WITH THE TAX PREPARER AND MANAGEMENT, AND THEN THEY WILL DISTRIBUTE THE FORM WITH ANY CHANGES TO THE ENTIRE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIVIDUALS HOLDING DESIGNATED POSITIONS SHALL FILE THEIR STATEMENTS OF ECONOMIC INTEREST, WHICH WILL MAKE THE STATEMENTS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AND REPRODUCTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEO: BOARD MEMBERS ON THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWED MATERIALS AND APPROVED CEO'S SALARY FOR FY 2017/18 AND BONUS FOR FY 2017. THE PROCESS IS COMPLETED ANNUALLY. OTHER EMPLOYEES: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVED AN INCREASE IN THE SALARIES FOR THE SENIOR LEADERSHIP TEAM AND AGREED TO A BONUS POOL FOR THIS TEAM. THE BONUS AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO THE CEO DISCRETION BASED ON THE PERFORMANCE OF THE INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS OF THE TEAM. THE CEO REVIEWS OTHER OFFICER SALARIES WITH THE BOARD CHAIR AS PART OF THE BUDGET PROCESS. FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES, A SALARY INCREASE WAS PROVIDED AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DURING FY 2017/2018. THE PROCESS IS COMPLETED ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE. OTHER DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.

ALDER IS A SEPARATE CALIFORNIA NON-PROFIT PUBLIC BENEFIT CORPORATION THAT WAS FOUNDED IN JULY 2015 WITH A MISSION TO DEVELOP A HIGH-CALIBER TEACHER, PRINCIPAL, AND LEADER PIPELINE FOR THE ORGANIZATION AND OTHER EDUCATION ORGANIZATIONS. ON JULY 1, 2017, ALDER REVISED ITS BYLAWS TO REMOVE ASPIRE PUBLIC SCHOOLS AS THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER AND THEREFORE, WAS DECONSOLIDATED FROM THE ORGANIZATION AS OF JUNE 30, 2018. AFTER DECONSOLIDATION, ALDER WAS NO LONGER CONSIDERED A RELATED PARTY TO THE ORGANIZATION.
